intro: Lisianthius princeps, commonly known as the Hawaiian lisianthius, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adapted to the unique environmental conditions of its habitat. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, showy yellow flowers. Due to habitat loss and introduced species, it is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
